snippet: The S.E.C. unveiled a civil case against a 10th former SAC Capital employee. | An internal investigation found that the Justice Department had repeatedly and significantly overstated its efforts to prosecute mortgage fraud. | G.E. filed to spin off...
abstract: The S.E.C. unveiled a civil case against a 10th former SAC Capital employee. | An internal investigation found that the Justice Department had repeatedly and significantly overstated its efforts to prosecute mortgage fraud. | G.E. filed to spin off its North American retail finance unit in an initial public offering. | Lions Gate agreed to admit to wrongdoing and pay a $7.5 million fine for failing to disclose how it stopped a takeover by Carl C. Icahn in 2010.

headline.main: S.E.C. Takes Aim at Another Former SAC Employee
